The Eiffel Tower can grow up to 6 inches taller during the summer due to thermal expansion.
Honey never spoils; archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs still perfectly edible.
Humans and giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae (seven).
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896, lasting only 38 minutes.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
The average person walks the equivalent of three times around the world in a lifetime.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Octopuses have three hearts.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space, but it's not visible with the naked eye.
The Earth's oceans contain nearly 20 million tons of gold.
Polar bears have black skin under their white fur to absorb and retain heat.
The average person blinks about 15-20 times per minute.
Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system, even hotter than Mercury, the closest planet to the Sun.
The name 'Google' originated from a misspelling of the word 'googol', which means 1 followed by 100 zeroes.
The fingerprints of a koala are so similar to humans that they have been confused at crime scenes.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 13 letters.
Honeybees can flap their wings 200 times per second.
Giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae as humans.
An octopus has three hearts.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus. It takes about 243 Earth days for Venus to complete one rotation.
The average person will spend six months of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.
The human brain is about 73% water.
Penguins have a gland above their eyes that converts seawater to freshwater, allowing them to drink water from the ocean.
A snail can sleep for three years.
The world's oldest piece of chewing gum is over 9,000 years old.
The longest time between two twins being born is 87 days.
A crocodile cannot stick its tongue out.
The Earth weighs around 5,970,000,000,000,000,000,000 tons.
The average person laughs about 13 times a day.
A group of crows is called a 'murder'.
The world's oldest known recipe is for beer.
Honeybees have hair on their eyes.
The odds of being born on Leap Day (February 29) are about 1 in 1,461.
A day on Mars is only slightly longer than a day on Earth. It lasts about 24 hours and 37 minutes.
The electric chair was invented by a dentist.
Ants stretch when they wake up in the morning.

A hummingbird weighs less than a penny.
